questions.question: ………………………… his illness, he has never missed any class.
questions.description: In spite should be followed by of.

questions.question: She is not very talented, ………………………., she is highly successful.
questions.description: Yet is a conjunction it can connect two clauses. However cannot connect two clauses although it expresses more or less the same idea.

questions.question: You should not leave ………………………… you are told to.
………………………….. you watch your diet, you are unlikely to develop serious health problems.
questions.description: Either if or as long as is possible here.

questions.question: You needn’t …………………………. for me.
questions.description: When need is an auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: …………………………. he was an illiterate, he managed to achieve success through hard work.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: ………………………….. you are free in the afternoon, we can meet for a coffee.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition. Unless is similar to if not.

questions.question: ……………………….. it was a busy day, I couldn’t even have lunch.
We shelved the project …………………………….. we could not find a sponsor.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. Because of a preposition. It is similar to due to.

questions.question: It has been several days …………………………. I talked to her.
As she was ill, I went …………………………… her.
